member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest
member.summary: The media stream that you want to add to the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.Attributes
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Attributes. The attributes that you want to assign to the new media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.ClockRate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ClockRate. The sample rate (in Hz) for the stream. If the media stream type is video or ancillary data, set this value to 90000. If the media stream type is audio, set this value to either 48000 or 96000.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description that can help you quickly identify what your media stream is used for.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.MediaStreamId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamId. A unique identifier for the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.MediaStreamName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamName. A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.MediaStreamType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamType. The type of media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddMediaStreamRequest.VideoFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VideoFormat. The resolution of the video.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest
member.summary: The output that you want to add to this flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.CidrAllowList
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CidrAllowList. The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description of the output. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the end user.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.Destination
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Destination. The IP address from which video will be sent to output destinations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.Encryption
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Encryption. The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.MaxLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxLatency. The maximum latency in milliseconds for Zixi-based streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.MediaStreamOutputConfigurations
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamOutputConfigurations. The media streams that are associated with the output, and the parameters for those associations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.MinLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinLatency. The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of the output. This value must be unique within the current flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.Port
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Port. The port to use when content is distributed to this output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.Protocol
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Protocol. The protocol to use for the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.RemoteId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RemoteId. The remote ID for the Zixi-pull output stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.SmoothingLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SmoothingLatency. The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.StreamId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamId. The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.AddOutputRequest.VpcInterfaceAttachment
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VpcInterfaceAttachment. The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.CreateFlowRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateFlow operation. Creates a new flow. The request must include one source. The request optionally can include outputs (up to 50) and entitlements (up to 50).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.CreateFlowRequest.AvailabilityZone
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone. The Availability Zone that you want to create the flow in. These options are limited to the Availability Zones within the current AWS Region.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Entitlements. The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.CreateFlowRequest.MediaStreams
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreams. The media streams that you want to add to the flow. You can associate these media streams with sources and outputs on the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.CreateFlowRequest.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.CreateFlowRequest.Outputs
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Outputs. The outputs that you want to add to this flow.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.CreateFlowRequest.SourceFailoverConfig
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SourceFailoverConfig.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Sources.

member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteFlow operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DeleteFlowResponse.Status

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeOffering operation. Displays the details of an offering. The response includes the offering description, duration, outbound bandwidth, price, and Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DescribeOfferingRequest.OfferingArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OfferingArn. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the offering.

member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeOffering operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DescribeOfferingResponse.Offering

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeReservation operation. Displays the details of a reservation. The response includes the reservation name, state, start date and time, and the details of the offering that make up the rest of the reservation (such as price, duration, and outbound bandwidth).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DescribeReservationRequest.ReservationArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ReservationArn. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the reservation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DescribeReservationResponse.Reservation

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfiguration
member.summary: The transport parameters that are associated with an outbound media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfiguration.DestinationIp
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DestinationIp. The IP address where contents of the media stream will be sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfiguration.DestinationPort
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DestinationPort. The port to use when the content of the media stream is distributed to the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfiguration.Interface
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Interface. The VPC interface that is used for the media stream associated with the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfiguration.OutboundIp
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutboundIp. The IP address that the receiver requires in order to establish a connection with the flow. This value is represented by the elastic network interface IP address of the VPC. This field applies only to outputs that use the CDI or ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfigurationRequest
member.summary: The transport parameters that you want to associate with an outbound media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfigurationRequest.DestinationIp
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DestinationIp. The IP address where you want MediaConnect to send contents of the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfigurationRequest.DestinationPort
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DestinationPort. The port that you want MediaConnect to use when it distributes the media stream to the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.DestinationConfigurationRequest.Interface
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Interface. The VPC interface that you want to use for the media stream associated with the output.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.EncodingParameters
member.summary: A collection of parameters that determine how MediaConnect will convert the content. These fields only apply to outputs on flows that have a CDI source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.EncodingParameters.CompressionFactor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CompressionFactor. A value that is used to calculate compression for an output. The bitrate of the output is calculated as follows: Output bitrate = (1 / compressionFactor) * (source bitrate) This property only applies to outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol, with a flow source that uses the CDI protocol. Valid values are floating point numbers in the range of 3.0 to 10.0, inclusive.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.EncodingParameters.EncoderProfile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EncoderProfile. A setting on the encoder that drives compression settings. This property only applies to video media streams associated with outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol, with a flow source that uses the CDI protocol.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.EncodingParametersRequest
member.summary: A collection of parameters that determine how MediaConnect will convert the content. These fields only apply to outputs on flows that have a CDI source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.EncodingParametersRequest.CompressionFactor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CompressionFactor. A value that is used to calculate compression for an output. The bitrate of the output is calculated as follows: Output bitrate = (1 / compressionFactor) * (source bitrate) This property only applies to outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol, with a flow source that uses the CDI protocol. Valid values are floating point numbers in the range of 3.0 to 10.0, inclusive.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.EncodingParametersRequest.EncoderProfile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EncoderProfile. A setting on the encoder that drives compression settings. This property only applies to video media streams associated with outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol, if at least one source on the flow uses the CDI protocol.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption
member.summary: Information about the encryption of the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Algorithm. The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.ConstantInitializationVector
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ConstantInitializationVector. A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.DeviceId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DeviceId. The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.KeyType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KeyType. The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.Region
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Region. The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.ResourceId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ResourceId. An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.RoleArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RoleArn. The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.SecretArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SecretArn. The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Encryption.Url
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Url. The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement
member.summary: The settings for a flow entitlement.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement.DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent. Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description of the entitlement.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement.Encryption
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Encryption. The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement.EntitlementArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntitlementArn. The ARN of the entitlement.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement.EntitlementStatus
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntitlementStatus. An indication of whether the entitlement is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Entitlement.Name

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.FailoverConfig.FailoverMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FailoverMode. The type of failover you choose for this flow. MERGE combines the source streams into a single stream, allowing graceful recovery from any single-source loss. FAILOVER allows switching between different streams.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property RecoveryWindow. Search window time to look for dash-7 packets

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.FailoverConfig.SourcePriority

member.summary: Gets and sets the property State.

member.summary: An entitlement that has been granted to you from other AWS accounts.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent. Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedEntitlement.EntitlementName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntitlementName. The name of the entitlement.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow
member.summary: Provides a summary of a flow, including its ARN, Availability Zone, and source type.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow.AvailabilityZone
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone. The Availability Zone that the flow was created in.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description of the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow.FlowArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FlowArn. The ARN of the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow.SourceType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SourceType. The type of source. This value is either owned (originated somewhere other than an AWS Elemental MediaConnect flow owned by another AWS account) or entitled (originated at an AWS Elemental MediaConnect flow owned by another AWS account).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListedFlow.Status
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Status. The current status of the flow.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListEntitlementsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListEntitlements operation. Displays a list of all entitlements that have been granted to this account. This request returns 20 results per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListEntitlementsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxResults. The maximum number of results to return per API request. For example, you submit a ListEntitlements request with MaxResults set at 5. Although 20 items match your request, the service returns no more than the first 5 items. (The service also returns a NextToken value that you can use to fetch the next batch of results.) The service might return fewer results than the MaxResults value. If MaxResults is not included in the request, the service defaults to pagination with a maximum of 20 results per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListEntitlementsRequest.NextToken
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NextToken. The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListEntitlements request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListEntitlements request a second time and specify the NextToken value.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListEntitlements operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListFlowsRequest.MaxResults

Although 20 items match your request, the service returns no more than the first 5 items. (The service also returns a NextToken value that you can use to fetch the next batch of results.) The service might return fewer results than the MaxResults value. If MaxResults is not included in the request, the service defaults to pagination with a maximum of 10 results per page.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property ResourceArn. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the AWS Elemental MediaConnect resource for which to list the tags.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListTagsForResource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse.Tags
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Tags. A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream
member.summary: A single track or stream of media that contains video, audio, or ancillary data. After you add a media stream to a flow, you can associate it with sources and outputs on that flow, as long as they use the CDI protocol or the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol. Each source or output can consist of one or many media streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.Attributes
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Attributes. Attributes that are related to the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.ClockRate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ClockRate. The sample rate for the stream. This value is measured in Hz.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description that can help you quickly identify what your media stream is used for.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.Fmt
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Fmt. The format type number (sometimes referred to as RTP payload type) of the media stream. MediaConnect assigns this value to the media stream. For ST 2110 JPEG XS outputs, you need to provide this value to the receiver.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.MediaStreamId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamId. A unique identifier for the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.MediaStreamName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamName. A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.MediaStreamType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamType. The type of media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStream.VideoFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VideoFormat. The resolution of the video.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamAttributes
member.summary: Attributes that are related to the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamAttributes.Fmtp
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Fmtp. A set of parameters that define the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamAttributes.Lang
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Lang. The audio language, in a format that is recognized by the receiver.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamAttributesRequest
member.summary: Attributes that are related to the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamAttributesRequest.Fmtp
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Fmtp. The settings that you want to use to define the media stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamAttributesRequest.Lang
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Lang. The audio language, in a format that is recognized by the receiver.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.MediaStreamOutputConfiguration

For public networking, the ListenerAddress is represented by the elastic IP address of the flow. For private networking, the ListenerAddress is represented by the elastic network interface IP address of the VPC. This field applies only to outputs that use the Zixi pull or SRT listener protocol.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.PurchaseOfferingRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PurchaseOffering operation. Submits a request to purchase an offering. If you already have an active reservation, you can't purchase another offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property OfferingArn. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property ReservationName. The name that you want to use for the reservation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.PurchaseOfferingRequest.Start
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Start. The date and time that you want the reservation to begin, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). You can specify any date and time between 12:00am on the first day of the current month to the current time on today's date, inclusive. Specify the start in a 24-hour notation. Use the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ, where T and Z are literal characters. For example, to specify 11:30pm on March 5, 2020, enter 2020-03-05T23:30:00Z.

This request can be made only on an output that does not have an entitlement associated with it. If the output has an entitlement, you must revoke the entitlement instead. When an entitlement is revoked from a flow, the service automatically removes the associated output.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation
member.summary: A pricing agreement for a discounted rate for a specific outbound bandwidth that your MediaConnect account will use each month over a specific time period. The discounted rate in the reservation applies to outbound bandwidth for all flows from your account until your account reaches the amount of bandwidth in your reservation. If you use more outbound bandwidth than the agreed upon amount in a single month, the overage is charged at the on-demand rate.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation.CurrencyCode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CurrencyCode. The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for your reservation is US dollars.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Duration. The length of time that this reservation is active. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property OfferingArn. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property OfferingDescription. A description of the offering. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property PricePerUnit. The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation.PriceUnits
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PriceUnits. The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property ReservationArn. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the reservation when you purchase an offering.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation.ReservationName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ReservationName. The name that you assigned to the reservation when you purchased the offering.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation.ReservationState
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ReservationState. The status of your reservation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation.ResourceSpecification

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Reservation.Start
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Start. The day and time that the reservation becomes active. You set this value when you purchase the offering.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Decryption. The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.EntitlementArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntitlementArn. The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.IngestPort
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IngestPort. The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.MaxBitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxBitrate. The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.MaxLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxLatency. The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.MaxSyncBuffer
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxSyncBuffer. The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.MediaStreamSourceConfigurations
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MediaStreamSourceConfigurations. The media streams that are associated with the source, and the parameters for those associations.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.MinLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinLatency. The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of the source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.Protocol
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Protocol. The protocol that is used by the source.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamId. The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.VpcInterfaceName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VpcInterfaceName. The name of the VPC interface to use for this source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.SetSourceRequest.WhitelistCidr
member.summary: Gets and sets the property WhitelistCidr. The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Associates the specified tags to a resource with the specified resourceArn. If existing tags on a resource are not specified in the request parameters, they are not changed. When a resource is deleted, the tags associated with that resource are deleted as well.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Tags. A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

member.summary: This is the response object from the TagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport
member.summary: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in a source or output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.CidrAllowList
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CidrAllowList. The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.MaxBitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxBitrate. The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.MaxLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxLatency. The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.MaxSyncBuffer
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxSyncBuffer. The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.MinLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinLatency. The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.Protocol
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Protocol. The protocol that is used by the source or output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.RemoteId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RemoteId. The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.SmoothingLatency
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SmoothingLatency. The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.Transport.StreamId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamId. The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption
member.summary: Information about the encryption of the flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Algorithm. The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.ConstantInitializationVector
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ConstantInitializationVector. A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.DeviceId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DeviceId. The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.KeyType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KeyType. The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.Region
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Region. The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.ResourceId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ResourceId. An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.RoleArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RoleArn. The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.SecretArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SecretArn. The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateEncryption.Url
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Url. The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFailoverConfig
member.summary: The settings for source failover

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFailoverConfig.FailoverMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FailoverMode. The type of failover you choose for this flow. MERGE combines the source streams into a single stream, allowing graceful recovery from any single-source loss. FAILOVER allows switching between different streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFailoverConfig.RecoveryWindow
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RecoveryWindow. Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFailoverConfig.SourcePriority
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SourcePriority. The priority you want to assign to a source. You can have a primary stream and a backup stream or two equally prioritized streams.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFailoverConfig.State
member.summary: Gets and sets the property State.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateFlowEntitlement operation. You can change an entitlement's description, subscribers, and encryption. If you change the subscribers, the service will remove the outputs that are are used by the subscribers that are removed.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Description. A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.Encryption
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Encryption. The type of encryption that will be used on the output associated with this entitlement.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.EntitlementArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntitlementArn. The ARN of the entitlement that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.EntitlementStatus
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntitlementStatus. An indication of whether you want to enable the entitlement to allow access, or disable it to stop streaming content to the subscriber’s flow temporarily. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect leaves the value unchanged.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.FlowArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FlowArn. The flow that is associated with the entitlement that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.Subscribers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Subscribers. The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.

member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateFlowEntitlement operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementResponse.Entitlement
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Entitlement. The new configuration of the entitlement that you updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.Model.UpdateFlowEntitlementResponse.FlowArn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FlowArn. The ARN of the flow that this entitlement was granted on.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaConnect.AmazonMediaConnectClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MediaConnect
API for AWS Elemental MediaConnect

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaConnect.AmazonMediaConnectClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaConnect.AmazonMediaConnectClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaConnect.AmazonMediaConnectClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaConnect.AmazonMediaConnectClient.#ctor(Amazon.MediaConnect.AmazonMediaConnectConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonMediaConnectClient Configuration Object
